name: Barbarian
description: Tribal warriors from the very fringes of civilization, barbarians are wild and uncouth. Barbarians exemplify physical prowess and natural prowess, but can feel uncomfortable in enclosed spaces.

exploits.name: Fleet of foot
exploits.description: In an outdoor environment, you gain a +2 bonus to your SPEED.

exploits.name: Mighty leap
exploits.description: Your horizontal free jump distance increases by 5' (one square).

exploits.name: Set in the old ways
exploits.description: You gain +5 to your MENTAL DEFENSE.

exploits.name: Primal charge
exploits.description: When charging, you howl and screech, moving twice your SPEED and gaining +2d6 to damage.

exploits.name: Hides & skins
exploits.description: You know how to make the most out of basic gear. Hide armor worn by a barbarian counts as one quality level higher than it actually is.

exploits.name: Leathery skin
exploits.description: You gain +2 natural SOAK from hard, conditioned, leathery skin.

exploits.name: Iron skin
exploits.description: Your natural SOAK bonus increases to +4.

exploits.name: Sacred terrain
exploits.description: Choose a terrain type, such as forest, plains, ocean, or mountains. When in that terrain, you gain a +1d6 to all dice pools; however, when not in that terrain, you suffer a -1d6 penalty to all dice pools.

exploits.name: Beastly visage
exploits.description: You have modified your body in various ways (scars, tattoos, piercings) as to make yourself as intimidating as possible. With a CHA vs. MENTAL DEFENSE attack, you can give a target within 30' who can see and hear you the Afraid condition.

exploits.name: Scarred visage
exploits.description: You are covered in scars. You are immune to the Bleeding condition.

exploits.name: Trophy collection
exploits.description: You collect gruesome trophies from your vanquished foes – teeth, skills, bones, etc. Each trophy replenishes one LUCK die in your LUCK dice pool, and loses its power once the LUCK die is spent. You may only claim a trophy if you delivered the killing blow to a creature of Medium size or larger.

exploits.name: Reap the whirlwind
exploits.description: You may spend two actions to make one melee attack against every adjacent foe. You cannot add additional exploits to these attacks.

exploits.name: Feral
exploits.description: You gain a bite attack; your natural damage increases by +1d6 and becomes piercing damage.

exploits.name: Natural serenity
exploits.description: In your chosen sacred terrain, you may pause for five minutes once per day, reflecting on nature and speaking to the Old Gods, to recover your full HEALTH.
